title: Tennis Podcast: Naomi Osaka and Ash Barty launch Shenzhen era in style with three-set victories
text:
Exciting matches have been a theme of the WTA Finals in recent years, and the event picked up in Shenzhen exactly where it left off in Singapore, with two closely-fought three setters on the opening day.

The Tennis Podcast team review Naomi Osaka’s win over Petra Kvitova, as well as a victory for Ash Barty over Belinda Bencic which helped her to become the first Australian woman to finish the year as World No 1.

What were the staging and levels of crowd support like in Shenzhen? In what way was Osaka’s honest and open coaching timeout with her father a demonstration of her mental strength rather than a sign of any weakness? And how did Barty pick up her game so dramatically after a slow start?
description: Exciting matches have been a theme of the WTA Finals in recent years, and the event picked up in Shenzhen exactly where it left off in Singapore, with two closely-fought three setters on the opening day.
